SystemSolaire

Class GeneratSiteMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • SystemSolaire.GeneratSiteMap

  • public class GeneratSiteMap
extends java.lang.Object
    GeneratSiteMap is a java class which has tow special methods( sauvgardXml , link addSiteMap) this class have one attribute how is an ArrayList of SiteMap Each GeneratSiteMap instance has a capacity. The capacity is the size of the array used to store the elements in the list. It is always at least as large as the list size. As elements are added to an ArrayList, its capacity grows automatically. The details of the growth policy are not specified beyond the fact that adding an element has constant amortized time cost.
    Since:
    JDK8.0
    Version:
    1.8.0_144 created at 02 Dec,2017
    Author:
    Ayad Ishak and Arhab Samira
    See Also:
    SiteMap, ArrayList

    • Method Detail

      • sauvgardXml

        public void sauvgardXml(java.io.File file)
        this method can create a Sitemaps which is an easy way for web masters to inform search engines about pages on their sites that are available for crawling. In its simplest form, a Sitemap is an XML file that lists URLs for a site along with additional metadata about each URL (when it was last updated, how often it usually changes, and how important it is, relative to other URLs in the site) SiteMap , so that search engines can more intelligently crawl the site.
        Parameters:
        file - the File that we will put in the sitemap.xml
        See Also:
        BufferedReader, ArrayList

      • reLectureXml

        this methode can read any text File
        Parameters:
        titel - the text File that we will read
        See Also:
        BufferedReader

      • addSiteMap

        public void addSiteMap(SiteMap s)
                throws SiteAlreadyExistsException
        this method can add a SiteMap to our ArrayList if it didn't exist yet if it exist the method throw a SiteAlreadyExistsException
        Parameters:
        s - the instance of SiteMap that we will add
        Throws:
        SiteAlreadyExistsException - when the Site excites in our sitemap.xml we throw this Exception
        See Also:
        SiteMap
